And I recount to you the quality of extracting some arrows, so that you pause and consider this rule and meaning behind what I have not said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those are not understood in the narrative nor are they comprehended by the free ones.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artisans compare a little about motion; and with that which is present about that which is absent; and find new operations and new instruments for the descent of foreign causes when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And thus I say that arrows are not expelled from the members in which they are inserted but according to two manners: either by attraction of the place into which they entered; or by the contrary action of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is expelled by the place into which it entered, or is an arrow penetrating flesh and then being thrust in and out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey the impulse of the hour in which it entered, then you must leave it for a few days until the flesh around it can heal, and reduce the attraction to it and its exit.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is inserted into bone and does not obey your impulse, then leave it for a few days and apply attraction and motion on any day, and it will be expelled.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not obey your attempt for some days, then you should know that you perforate in the circuit of the arrow at that bone from any part moving subtly where the place is enlarged by the arrow.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the head and has already pierced one of the brain ventricles, and appears in the wound after some days, as those accidents which you and others call them, then abstain from removing the arrow and leave it where its being will be equated for some days; or if the arrow reaches the brain, then death is not prolonged to him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not lodged in the bone of the body only and does not pass into the brain, but remains in the wound for some days, and you do not suffer any of those accidents from it, then you proceed with the extraction of the arrow and treat it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is firmly lodged and you do not obey your extraction, then you administer travels in the circuit of the arrow as we have recommended, and proceed to cure the place until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already hidden in the place of the body and hidden from sensation, then you inquire about that area carefully, and if you feel it, then remove it with some instruments which are suitable for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot extract it due to the thickness of the flesh and the length of the arrow, and here there are neither bones nor nerves nor veins, then you cut into the flesh where it can be expanded and where the arrow can be extracted.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is in the ears where it is lodged, then you excise the flesh in which it is embedded as much as possible with all the skill you can; and use your ingenuity, if you cannot extract the flesh in the fracture of the ears or in their torsion where compliance is required.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then you use the grip of your hand with forceps at all parts where it makes that comply; and with subtle skill ensure that the arrow is not broken and that it is made easier for its extraction and for that extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot do this at that time of your hour, then you leave it for some days until the parts that are in the circuit of him heal, and then return to that which is alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if it makes contrary evil flow of blood, then you administer what we have said about cure in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And keep your virtue in the incision of vein or nerve, or cord, and administer engen in every manner for the evasion of the arrow; and do this with facility, tranquility, and tardiness as I and you have recommended.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And do this to contract the arrow by itself that the patient be according to the figure according to which you should place the tip of the arrow in him, for it is more advantageous.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But the arrows that are redirected contrary to the other part, or that you have already treated some part of them on the external parts, or cause obstruction in the tip of the arrow by the sensation of the part more superior to the arrow's base; then you dry over that; and the drying should be according to the quantity in which the forceps take hold; and then remove it, for it is made light by displacement.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is retained in the bone, then twist the ligament according to the opposite direction where the arrow presses on the bone, and gradually enlarge it, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	If not, let that remain for a few days, and then repeatedly apply it to where it hurts.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft of the arrow is there, then push it into place.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft is embedded and you want to administer an impulse, then insert it there. If it is stubborn, create a concavity with your finger so that between the concavity of the wound and the arrow's head, then push it into place.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrow is concave, then push it with strong pressure into place, as the arrow will expand due to this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	If the arrow is poisoned, then ensure that you indent all the flesh where it entered, if possible, and then treat it with whatever is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow hits the foot, or the abdomen, or the bladder, or the side, and is close enough for you to touch it with your hand, and it is possible to extract it there, then extract it while it is dry, take care not to injure a vein or nerve, and after closing the wound, treat it until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which arrows are extracted:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the ends be curved like the mouth of an ass, so that they can grasp the arrow and not let it slip.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of these forceps are made special kinds, large, few, and medium-sized, according to the size of the arrow and its smallness, and the width of the wound, and the condition of the wound.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Form of the concave end of this extremity is made like the cleft of an ass so that it can ease the removal of the arrow and pushes the deaf one out.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	Thus, so that it may be alleviated for the instrument in the concave groove and is pushed towards that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of femoral venous puncture.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	Of femoral venous puncture. The veins from which it is customary to perform phlebotomy are the femoral veins, which are located in chapter XVI, and they consist of two pulsating veins near the ears, called by Avicenna; two herbs that are prominently visible on the temples; and two veins under the eyes, called aspients; one vein in the middle part of the forehead, and one vein at the extremity of the nose; two jugular veins at the neck; two veins on the upper lip; two veins on the lower lip; — these are the veins called algelic —; and there are two veins behind the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are punctured in the brachial region are five; of these, one is cephalic, and is from the wild basilisk; and the people call it "the vein of the head," but it is sorda, a midline vein, composed of one branch of the basilica and another branch of the cephalic; they call this one by the people "the vein of the whole body," and the basilica is the vein that is from the domestic basilisk and is called "citillary," and the vulgar call it "the vein of the belly"; one from the funis of the arm, which is placed on the axilla, and it is this in which phlebotomy is performed, and it is this that appears above the armpit by its obvious appearance; salvatella, which is the vein between the said auricular and the smaller said, and it is in it two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	In the foot and thigh there are three veins; one of them is that which gives curvature to the curve of the wild deer's neck; and the second is sophena, and its place is given in the thigh of the domestic deer; and the sciatic vein, and its place is given in the thigh of the wild deer; and in the thigh are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The condition of the veins near the ears is catarrh, migraines, meningitis, and old bad ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of sanguine in those veins is as I will recount to you: it should be drawn from above the patient's head, and the patient's head should be rubbed at the occipital region where both veins are with a wide cloth for good friction; then strongly hold the patient by their neck with a band through which the two locations near the ears appear in two pressed areas of the head; and you should take that from what I said, and if you feel the pulse of those at your own wrist, here it is tried.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then take the surgical lancet, which is the one that will be used for incision, and insert it into the vein between where the phlebotomy will reach the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then lift your hand to the vein and its parts above, and cut the vein with an incision inclined upwards.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the width of two fingers adjusted or around that; and let the blood flow out as much as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then sprinkle powder and leave it there until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already it was mentioned at the beginning of this book about the incision and their cautery.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	More of the two arteries, which supply the temple with blood for the femoral venesection, is the ancient and evil emigranea (likely a misspelling or variant of "hemigranea," meaning one-sided headache) and continuous cataract and body full of acute effusions in the heels.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of performing phlebotomy on these is as I will recount to you: tightly bind the patient's thigh with a ligature until the two veins appear clearly by touch and the pulse of their location is demonstrated by your finger; then you can proceed.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then you raise the codena above the vein at the parts above as you have just indicated, and insert the fleubotomi incidently, and raise the vein in them; and cut that as you did with the two other veins, and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then release the compression of the thigh, and place your hand over the vein for an hour, and then place a compress and powder there with a strong constriction, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And then the recollection of the wound, and after that the incision, and the puncture at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore the treatment of bleeding from the vein in the forehead is similar to the bleeding from the cephalic vein for ancient illnesses of the face, and for headaches, inflammation, and foul ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the bleeding from the vein is as I will recount to you; it is that the patient tightens his thigh with a bandage where the vein appears; and then take the instrument, which is called a fosseri, the form of which is as follows:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the puncture at the point which is at the top of the outlet over that vein and strike it either from above or according to the manner of the limb, and let the blood flow according to the quantity you wish; then remove the perforation in the patient and strengthen it so that it may heal.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	In some cases, the space is opened with a large incision for bloodletting, but I do not know if the bloodletting incision should be of acute extremity as with other bloodlettings, it should rather be of lateral extremity, and cut transversely, because the bone is close by and strong; cutting the bloodletting incision would likely break the bone when it is thin.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	More importantly, the young vessels that are at the inner corners of the eyes through the skin of the eye by inflammation and swelling in the eyes, and for facial ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	The quality of the bloodletting is that the patient strengthens his own column with a bandage, and then perform the bloodletting, while you stand over the patient's head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And perform the incision for venesection according to the transverse length a little, making only a few venesections, for in that place there is no flesh; and if the venesection is fine, firmly secure the extremity of it.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then let the blood run until it is as necessary for you, pause over those cuts, and strengthen them with a new bandage, and then remove those.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	More so, the incision of the vein in the nose is appropriate for acute fever and severe toxicity, as well as maladies of the face such as migraines and redness that occur in the face, especially when it is chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the incision for it is that the patient supports his head with his left hand, and you take the fine long venesection and place it in the middle location of the nasal cavity according to the correct direction, for the vein does not appear here, and thus the blood begins to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Cover your hand with the venesection little by little and let the blood flow according to your need; then remove it after a night, for that is quickly restored.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	May the youth of the femoral incision lead to a constriction of the leg and a beginning of leprosy and various illhealths and bad ulcers corrosive like herpotromeno.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that the patient feels intense pain in his thigh; and the surgeon is over the patient's head, and the patient lies on a bench.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And gradually incise the vein along its length for a femoral incision, making it wider little by little; and extract the blood according to the season in quantity or according to what is necessary; and make it similar to the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And gradually remove the lint and strengthen the two veins with a midwifery thread so that the patient does not become overheated, and leave within the flesh until the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the youth of the femoral incision for algiric veins, apply to small abscesses and pustules from the mouth and corruption of the gums, as well as bad ulcers and fissures, and those bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that you make a cut in front of the groin, strengthen its neck with a bandage, and then turn the labia and look at two veins, one on the right side of the labia and the second on the left; the demonstration of each is by the blackness of each of both, and this more so is found in the circuit of those small dark veins; and then cut each with a cutting incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	And if doubt exists, you, and you do not know which is which among them, then proceed with the incision of the larger one, and the more obvious one among them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the appearance of the two veins that are in the upper labia.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	And it is customarily better to cut both veins that are in the lower labia.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	And of the two veins that are in the lower labia, the treatment for the tongue's benefit is close to the femoral incision at positions that are in the scrotum, for the illness of the uvula, and for illnesses of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of performing a flebotomy is to follow the patient's leg in front of their groin, elevate the tongue of the leg, and observe the tongue, from one side of the vein and the other side of the vein, and the color of each is declining to black.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then perform a flebotomy on each; and make sure that you do not end the flebotomy on those, for they are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are flebotomized in the crease are those in which blood flows customarily in all men, and the flebotomy of them is done according to two methods: either place a small mirtilo or olive stick subtlety; or perform a surgical flebotomy with a lancet, and call it alnessil. This is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this alnessil is to incise and of those specific shallow, subtle cuts according to the width of the veins and according to the structure of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of flebotomy with mirtilo:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the wound be as you see, and it is necessary to open the concave veins full of large visible branches, and those that contain thick turbid blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	This is the method for phlebotomy for an olive:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this femoral incision is of lesser width and more delicate extremity, and it suits the femoral veins that contain subtle citrine pus.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	And the youth of the femoral incision from the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: from which we extract the blood from the bad illnesses that affect the knee and the foot, and from what taints the leg and the abdomen.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it suits the phlebotomist, when performing that phlebotomy, to be well aware of it and to be overly cautious, for if he errs in the puncture of the phlebotomy, he will cut that artery and cause flows of blood, so that it is necessary to ensure that you do not phlebotomize there before cutting as with a lancet.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear by a clear manifestation, then you should leave that and change to another, or search for some of its branches; or perform phlebotomy at the end of the arm where it is manifest, and do phlebotomy with a lancet there as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	If you want the femoral flebotomy, proceed in front of the stricture of the thigh where you feel the location of the pulse, then place your hand on it to hold; then lift the thigh and make a concave incision along the vein as we have said before; be careful that you do not percuss too much over some space of the artery's location.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	When you press, as you tighten the ligament, inflammation occurs in the location where you held it with your hand, then that inflammation is due to the artery, so avoid that area.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if the blood flows in the femoral flebotomy as it does from a child's wound, thin and rapid, then you know that it is the blood of the artery; then compress and hold your hand over that area for a long space; near this hold your hand, and if the blood is divided, four or five drops are divided, then strengthen the thigh and leave that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And keep the patient from the moccio of the wound, and have no fear of it, but do not wet that for a few days until it is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood does not stop, and sometimes you must not perform this for lack of present medicine; then when you incise the artery, if it appears to you; for its extremity is constricted and the blood is stopped; or take some from your fist, and do that, and take half and strengthen that over the place of the vein at strictura descent with liament and powder between on another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	But if the blood is stopped, that is good; and if not, then cure that with what preceded in the remembrance of the place of the powders stopping the flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the stopping of the blood in such small areas is difficult due to the size of the wound and the possibility of applying powder from the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But from the dark vein, phlebotomy is beneficial that extracts the blood from the part that will ascend to the head and from the part left below the body; for this is composed of a branch of the basilica vein and a branch of the cephalic vein, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And cover the incision after the phlebotomy where it is over-tremor in the phlebotomy of him; for that one is a nerve; and then if he adjusts at the puncture of the phlebotomy and finds the nerve, there will be stupor to him, and it is difficult the healing of him, and not strong he is healed completely. This nerve motions sometimes appear in sensation; and if it is hidden at some men and is subtle and is not shown, then cover the phlebotomy that you make by section of alnessil, and avoid the nerve by your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein in length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The purpose of the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is to draw the blood from the head and relieve the ailments of the heels.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And cover this properly, if you want to make the phlebotomy puncture at the olive phlebotomy or at the mirti phlebotomy; for it is the safe place of all veins, for neither the artery nor the nerve are found there.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	Moreover, however, you should perform the incision carefully, ensuring that you do not puncture the upper part of the vein, but rather locate the area slightly lower, and do not mark it, unless it is easily accessible by percussion just before the incision site.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	Moreover, however, an abscess is often found in some people, when it is not lanced in the first percussion, then do not mark it again with a lance.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	Moreover, the quality of the incision and the accidents related to it are matters that you should consider in their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you should know that an incision should be made only to maintain health and with hope for its successful outcome, and with caution regarding the occurrence of illnesses. And that the incision should be made on one of the veins that are in the thigh: cephalic, femoral, and basilic; and that the incision should be made at the beginning of spring, fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter before eating, when signs of congestion appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And a femoral incision should be made and on the seventh day or at the first hour of the next day, three hours should have passed.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	The more frequent the femoral incision is administered, the more it should be done when it proves convenient and necessary, whether at night or during the day, at any hour and at all times.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And let a boy not be circumcised before he has four years, and a girl that is pregnant should not be circumcised but only in the fourth month before the seventh. And women should not be circumcised those which have passed forty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when anyone wants to be circumcised for any reason, let them modify their intestines before the circumcision by applying a lion's suppository, if there is an obstructed wound, so that the veins do not carry superfluous fluid during the circumcision of the intestines, which are purified and do not affect the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And let no patients who are seasick, intoxicated, or recovering from illness or drunkenness be circumcised until they have fully recovered from such conditions. Nor those suffering from dropsy. Circumcision should be more feared near colic pain, near vomiting, near abdominal issues, near the multiplication of coitus and work and exercise after fasting or watching over, and for any cause that dissolves virtue, either corporeally or spiritually.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And then consider in subtlety of humors before this if the wound is large, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if this is possible for it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And then enter the bath if any cause does not prohibit it, or exercise for some reason that the wound may be subtletized.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And place the phlebotomy on the feet of the patient, so when it is around the hour of three, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And I assure you that the feet of that patient should be protected on that day from all evil accidents, as when there is anxiety, anger, fear, and all bodily accidents, as when there is toil and excessive labor, copulation, and things similar to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And at her service, have ready the causes in the use of which custom dictates the presence of aromatics and odors, and balms according to the quantity and possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the phlebotomist on a cushion that is higher than the cushion of the one who is to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then extract his arm, rub that area with your hand using the scalpel two or three times; then tie the thread with a strap and wrap that area two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And if the stricture is tempered, that is, when the stricture is not equal, or the stricture is due to excess, then prohibit the flow of blood; or it is due to mollification, and then prohibit the body's release of blood accordingly.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And when the stricture is near, have those who are to perform the incision rub their hands together between them as the veins become swollen and clearly discernible.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And when the scalpel is about to make the incision, apply a little antiseptic oil properly to it; then place your left hand's index finger on the vein, positioning the location for the incision so that the vein slightly expands and becomes more evident. The incision should be made where you find the vein similar to a fleeing cord, as this area is full of venosity. When you pause the incision over that area, the vein contracts, and the scalpel reveals its position. If the incision does not open the vein, it should be tightened; if it opens, the incision is correct.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And thus, one must ensure that the phlebotomist is fixed and stimulated in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then place the phlebotomy, but if the vein is not opened in one pass, that is good; otherwise, you repeat this or another pass, letting that area a little more, or over it apply warmth, if the area is not infected.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the area is infected, or the patient faints, then you let it be for a day or two, and do not bind it tightly, for it would force the infection out through the wound, nor immerse it in water.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And then repeat the phlebotomy if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the wound is small and the vein is thinly situated, and you fear that it may not yield enough blood, then repeat the phlebotomy in that area according to correctness and adjust based on the appearance. Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you find that it has already suppurated, then do not operate on it, for no excuse would serve your cause; instead, place yourself over some part of the wound, for it alleviates the body's pain.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place than oil and other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly, in all phlebotomies where the veins are cut to prevent blood from flowing back into the body, administer oil as a substitute. They use tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when placed over the area, for the blood becomes subtle and is circulated when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess forms in the phlebotomy site, where motas (blisters) occur, especially for those who have not been bled recently but during this session, or near the appearance of the small vein, then you should apply and place a sponge infused in water and salt, slightly heated, strongly maintaining it for an hour, for it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And make sure to do this near the termination of the vein with the help of it or another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if there is any blackness or greenishness in the area for a few days, do not note this; and if you wish, place over that area some cause of aloes and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of mint juice or vinegar or its semblance.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And when red spots occur, you should perform a bloodletting of the basilicus vein.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And place your hand over it. E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And apply a plaster where there is stiffness, so that the area may become harder, and then treat it with another remedy until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And ensure that you draw from the vein according to the quantity of its virtue and according to the prevailing color over the blood according to how it appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, let it remain until it is resolved; similarly, if you see it thick, let it remain until it becomes thin; similarly, if it is sharp, let its acuteness subside.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat. E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in venous bloodletting is a transverse section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut. E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre. E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes that have been said in the division in the chapter on fainting fit for evacuation.

Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent. E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal. Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit. E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the inflammation subsides.

E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of cannulating that vein is that the surgeon inserts his hand in cold water when the dilated vein becomes clearly apparent.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut. E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the incision be wide, and let your cannulation be in the place where you cannulate that vein near the wrist of the hand.

And if you are to stop the flow of blood, then immerse your hand in the trailing water and let the blood run into the water until you achieve your need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	And if you are in the days of summer, then you may be excused from immersing your hand in the trailing water, and instead stop the flow of blood in the body during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than that of all other veins, for it does not have a pulsating vein or nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the radial wrist vein is related to the ailments of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of phlebotomy from this vein is that you strengthen your hand with an amulet or with your own hand, rather than keeping it in trailing water, until the vein is swollen and clearly demonstrated; then quickly make the transverse incision; and if you cut through it completely, no harm will come of it.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And make sure that you do not place your hand over the fistula, for leave it with the nerves of the fingers naked and without flesh.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	Moreover, for the care of the fistula from the left hand, it is important to address the diseases of the liver.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do similarly in the fistula of the foot as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the care of the femoral vein in the fistula is for diseases that affect the lower part of the body, such as liver diseases, and retention of menstruation, as well as diseases of hernias and old chest ulcers, and their similar cases of diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that the patient inserts his leg in cold water and makes friction thereupon through which the veins appear; and over the joint of the leg he places a cord; and at the location of the vein he cuts it apparently, and from there its ramifications on the face of the leg multiply.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And thus perform the femoral incision wider if you must cut the cord, and at the location cut the addition of it, which is better and more salutary.

And if you perform the femoral incision on the face of the leg, then you must guard the nerves that are left on the face of the leg, and place your incision over the location where you make it transverse, as if you were going to excise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the femoral incisions be vertical.

If the incision by the ligger is incorrect in the first attempt, then retry the incision there a little more, for the area is salt; and do not fear its mischief, but rather protect yourself from the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly make the incision on the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, as we have said before, you should leave the tendon of the calf with the wild artery.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the pain from the ligation of the sciatic vein is in the hip when it is due to cauterization.

And the quality of the ligation of the sciatic vein is that the patient enters the bath, strengthens, and tightens his thigh with a long thin bandage over the tendon above four fingers, for it does not appear any other way.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, then ligate that one according to whatever skill is at your disposal and according to the transversal, which is better. And it is often improved by a slight incision; and if you find it but does not appear in the feeling altogether, then perform a flebotomy on some branch of it, and that which appears at the second interphalangeal joint instead of the thumb and little finger.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	For ventilation and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventilation is of corns, or of ears, or of eyes.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is performed in two ways: one way involves incision and extraction of blood, and the other way is through ventilation without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation without incision is performed in two ways, either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And at the vertices where bloodletting and extraction of abscesses are administered, there are four locations of the body, of which one where the vertices are paused is on the occipital region, and is the last part of the head; and the second location is in half of the neck; and abscesses from the chin leave the jaw behind and then the mouth; and abscesses from two spatulas; and abscesses from alohoster, which are above the end of the coccyx; and abscesses from two forks, each being two inches; and abscesses from two cervices; and abscesses from two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And bloodletting should not extract the abscess but from the small scattered veins in the flesh, and by this does not lose its virtue through those, as it is done by phlebotomy; nor should bloodletting be performed with fire or several fires in any illness caused by repletion where the body is completely evacuated.

But if necessity provokes bloodletting for an illness or during its continuance, we should administer it at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it, and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that in men where blood is multiplied during digestion due to the extraction of wind and they find great weight and hardness on their head; and among those who find fullness and redness on their face and head, and on their neck; and among those who find pain on their face and forehead with darkness and drowsiness on their eyes; and among those who feel the place of wind extraction; and among those whose laughter is multiplied; and among those who find taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue swells and they spit blood; and among those whose sleep is multiplied, and those who see blood during sleep as redness, spots, and other causes like theirs.

E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this phlebotomy is at the location of the cephalic vein.

E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual. Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What must be done that the wind-dispeller and blood-letting be performed before ventilation.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.
